title: Insurance (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 47 of 2021) shall, in so far as it is not
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Health Insurance (Amendment) Act
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Health Insurance (Amendment) Act 

2021 (Commencement) Order 2023.
text_norm: 1 order may cited health insurance (amendment) act 2021 (commencement) order 2023

title: Insurance (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 47 of 2021) shall, in so far as it is not
heading: 2. The 1st day of April 2023 is appointed as the day on which the Health
text_raw:
2. The 1st day of April 2023 is appointed as the day on which the Health 
Insurance (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 47 of 2021) shall, in so far as it is not 
already in operation, come into operation. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

9 March, 2023. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th March, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [112] 3

title: Insurance (Amendment) Act 2021 (No. 47 of 2021) shall, in so far as it is not
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order appoints 1 April 2023 as the date on which paragraphs (b) and (c) of 
section 5 of the Health Insurance (Amendment) Act 2021 come into operation. 
The amendment introduces a time limit on the period in which risk equalisation 
credits can be claimed by health insurers from the Risk Equalisation Fund. It sets 
out that claims cannot be made to the Health Insurance Authority if entitlement 
to claim (or part thereof) arose more than six years before the 31 March in the 
year prior to the date of making the claim. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [112]
